intro: Consolida ajacis, commonly known as sweet rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its tall, branching stems and clusters of bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. Native to Europe, it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and ease of cultivation.
